page.title: 12THE GREAT WESTERN SOCIETY
page.content: This year, 1985, the 150th anniversary of the Great Western Railway is being celebrated. The Great Western Society, which is run by its members, is organising many activities this year, including Â£steaming days', when the public may travel in coaches pulled by steam engines which have been magnific- ently restored by the members themselves. The original GWR station was burnt down and its roof destroyed. Now Frome is the only GWR station which still has its original covered roof. The Great Western Society moved into the sheds in 1965. Many members spend their free time renovating the engines, waggons and coaches. Near the sheds are two shops, a museum and a stall. The whole area around the sheds is an attractive and interesting place in which to spend a day. It is open most weekends and Bank Holidays.
